name: Moneybox
slogan: Helping everyone save and invest in their future!
description:
We are on a mission to help everyone save and invest for their future.

Millions of us go through life knowing that we should be doing more to save and invest for the future. We leave it at the bottom of our to-do-list because we don’t know where to start.


We are not taught how to save & invest at school, the investment industry is built to serve a wealthy minority and banks are only interested in selling products not helping us achieve outcomes.

We are determined to change this by:

- making it easier for people to get started
- offering products to suit every need
- encouraging people to make the right decisions throughout their lives.
- bringing everything together in a service which is simple and enjoyable to use

We are already helping over 300,000 people save and invest for their future. This is just the beginning. Join us and help us change saving investing for the better!

jobs.title: Motion Graphic Designer (high growth startup) MB0060
jobs.description:
About Moneybox

A generation is growing up without the tools or information they need to confidently build their financial future.

Whether the next goal is getting on the property ladder, starting their own business or paying for the big day, they are not being supported effectively by current providers.

For many, the concept of ‘wealth’ seems alien; it seems both too general and something only other people have.

That’s because there isn’t enough help available;
•	the ‘wealth management’ industry is set up for those who already have wealth, not those who need to build it. 
•	banks are focused on selling products rather than helping people to achieve financial outcomes. 
•	financial planning is not taught at school or at work. 

All of this means people don’t know where to start, taking part feels alien and unachievable everything seems very complicated

Our ambition is to help a generation invest in their future.


Job Brief

The aim of this role is to create amazing 2D animation and motion designs help us acquire new customers and establish Moneybox as the go-to brand for wealth building.

We are looking for a full-service designer who aspires to create visual content of the highest level. You will be someone who is passionate about making things beautiful.


What You’ll Do

This role will be responsible for but not limited to the following:
•	Work directly with the marketing and product teams to promote the Moneybox app to potential customers and deliver an engaging in-app experience for existing customers.
•	Support end-to-end creative process from concept / ideation phase through to execution. A large part of the role will involve the creation of 2D animation.
•	Creating high quality assets for a range of channels such as paid social and video on demand
•	Create some assets for outdoor/offline consumption
•	Ad-hoc design projects


Who you are

•	Curious about latest design trends and techniques.
•	Interested in performance – you’ll be keen to understand the effectiveness of your campaigns and how this can inform creative decision-making. 
•	Excited about being part of a fast-growing company that’s trying to make a positive mark on the world.
•	No previous understanding of finance necessary, but you must be willing to immerse yourself in the product and the needs of our customers.
•	Knows have to have fun whilst maintaining a professional outlook.


Experience and Skills

•	BA degree in visual/motion design discipline
•	Proven experience of working in a full time motion design position 
•	Expert level user of the Adobe Creative Suite.
•	Working knowledge of After Effects to create motion graphics, animations 
•	Collaborative team player and able to take feedback on board.
•	Able to plan time effectively and deliver against tight deadlines. 
•	Excellent attention to detail and a strong eye for composition, movement and depth.
•	Fluent written and spoken English


What’s in it for you?

•	Opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at a fast-growing, award-winning and super ambitious startup.
•	Work with a friendly team of highly-motivated individuals.
•	Be in an environment where you are listened to and can play a key role in impacting the finance industry in the UK.
•	Thriving collaborative and inclusive company culture.
•	Competitive remuneration package.
•	Company share options. 
•	Perkbox - selection of 200+ perks. 
•	25 days holiday + bank holidays.
 
Our office is in London, by the Oxo Tower

jobs.description:
About Moneybox

A generation is growing up without the tools or information they need to confidently build their financial future.

Whether the next goal is getting on the property ladder, starting their own business or paying for the big day, they are not being supported effectively by current providers.

For many, the concept of ‘wealth’ seems alien; it seems both too general and something only other people have.

That’s because there isn’t enough help available;

The ‘wealth management’ industry is set up for those who already have wealth, not those who need to build it.

Banks are focused on selling products rather than helping people to achieve financial outcomes.

Financial planning is not taught at school or at work.

All of this means people don’t know where to start, taking part feels alien and unachievable everything seems very complicated

Our ambition is to help a generation invest in their future.

Moneybox is on a mission to change the way people save and invest toward their future. Forget old-school finance - we make saving and investing part of your everyday life and help you achieve your goals, be it buying a house, saving for your children or something much more frivolous!

Moneybox enables you to invest the change from your everyday purchases into simple tracker funds. For example, when you buy your morning coffee for £2.40, you can invest the 60p change into tracker funds within your ISA. This means that a you can set money aside to invest before you’ve finished your breakfast – not a bad start to the day!

We have won multiple awards, and are currently one of the fastest growing fintech apps in the UK.

We were founded in July 2015 by serial entrepreneurs Ben Stanway and Charlie Mortimer and currently have a team of 75.

We are authorised and regulated by the FCA and are backed by some of the UK’s leading venture capital investors.
Job Brief

Moneybox wants to help a generation invest in their future. As part of this mission we have launched a new service that makes it quick and easy to transfer all your old pension pots into the

Moneybox app. As a member of the Pension Transfers Team, you’ll be instrumental in helping our first pension customers get fully set up and making sure the customer experience is a great one!

You’ll be answering questions from customers, calling pension providers, and constantly feeding

back to the pensions Product Team with any improvements that can be made to the process. This role is instrumental in the development of the team and Moneybox pension as a whole, ensuring that the customer service received by all customers is efficient, intuitive, and exceptional.

What you’ll do

You’ll work closely with the customer operations and customer delight team in tasks including:

Managing the pensions transfer process end to end for our customers.
Answering queries from prospective Moneybox Pension customers.
Communicating with customers and keeping them fully informed on their transfer
status.
Liaising with pension providers to follow-up any ‘pending’, paused, or slow transfers,
Constantly reviewing all operational processes to look for areas of improvement and working with the relevant team to action these.
Helping with the creation of internal documents to track and monitor best practices.
Assisting the documentation and feedback of metrics around transfers to allow for constant review and optimisation.

Who you are

A driven, ambitious individual who’s looking to build their career at an exciting very- fast-growing company.
Someone with an understanding and customer-focused attitude.
An analytic person with a problem-solving attitude to help make sure all customer’s transfers are completed from beginning to end.
Someone able to communicate sometimes complex concepts to customers in a friendly manner.
Similarly, they’re able to convey a professional and persistent approach with existing pension providers.
Naturally personable, a great communicator who has a passion for their work.
A fun, ‘team player’ excited to be part of a new and friendly team.Experience and Skills
Excellent written and spoken English.
Ability to work well both individually and as part of a team.
Good analytical and problem solving skills.
Great communication and listening skills.
Meticulous attention to detail.

Bonus points for:

Previous customer service experience.
Previous experience with the pension industry.

Job Brief

We are in the process of building out our Product team to support the development of new and innovative customer focused features. We are looking for a recent graduate who is excited to change how people in the UK save and invest. You will work in the product team reporting to the Head of Product responsible for delivering new features to market, managing existing product performance and prioritising and planning product improvements.

Your mission is to help a generation save and invest for their future by creating the best in class experience.

Specify the product requirements together with the product team and write clear user stories and feature specifications that are ready to be implemented by the development team.

Collaborate with user experience, mobile and backend teams in the development of our product features to drive adoption and develop strategies to maximise product engagement.

Contribute to the development of the roadmap and prioritisation of user stories.

No prior Product Management experience is required. 

Who you are

A driven, ambitious individual who’s looking to build their career at an exciting very-fast-growing company.

You have strong attention to detail and are able to deliver effectively against tight deadlines.

Determined to succeed, high energy with humility and a strong personal drive.
Excited about working in Product Management for a fintech company and, more specifically, for Moneybox.

Knows how to have to have fun whilst maintaining a professional outlook.

Experience and Skills

University educated with at least one degree, preferably in a technical subject.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent attention to detail.

Ability to encourage, motivate and develop a diverse group of people towards a challenging goal.

Great communication and listening skills.

What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity to join a fast-growing, award-winning and super ambitious startup and have a huge impact on how a generation invests for their future.

Work with a friendly team of highly motivated individuals.

Experience and contribute to an environment where you are listened to.
Thriving collaborative and inclusive company culture.

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.description:
This position will suit an experienced QA engineer who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment.
You will be working with a high calibre team to continuously develop new products/features.


What You’ll Do
- Review technical and business requirements (incl. acceptance criteria) and design robust & reusable test scenarios.
- Manage the execution of test scenarios and report results, capturing run & key metrics overtime.
- Design and implement strategic level QA documentation/frameworks for the Cloud Apps workstream.
- Integrate Cloud Apps test scenarios with the overall test & automation strategy.
- Design and execute testing for complex features as required.
- Act as a point of contact for QA issues that arise during testing of the Cloud Apps workstream.
- Support the organisational shift towards continuous testing delivery (incl. implementing automated testing frameworks).
- Analyse live issues with a focus on continuous improvement.
- Assess feature suitability for test automation (incl. unit tests for developers & API integration
- tests)

- Log, prioritise & track bugs to completion.
- Maintaining documentation related to the QA stream.
- Create and maintain strong working relationships, working closely with other teams to ensure issues are progressed.
- Collaborate across the wider team, predominantly with the development, product & UX teams.
- Support other QA workstreams (e.g. Mobile & Platform) with test execution during busy periods.
- Attending daily stand-ups, sprint planning, refinement sessions & retrospectives as required.
- As a key member of the QA team you’ll help ensure the quality of products, improve existing QA processes and mentor others. Reporting into the QA lead.


Who You Are
- Collaborative, keen to mentor & share ideas.
- Shares experiences with others to assist their learning and understanding.
- Analytical and critical thinking mindset.
- A strong problem solver who is able to embrace new challenges.
- Strong organisation and planning skills with meticulous attention to detail.
- Excited about being part of a fast-growing company that’s trying to make a positive mark on the world.
- Someone who is interested in fintech, and excited to change how people in the UK save and invest.
- Passionate about all things mobile and apps.
- Up to date with the latest developments with technology and QA.
- Comfortable working collaboratively in a multi-disciplinary team.
- Pragmatic when raising bugs and understand the difference between - quality and meeting release deadlines.


Experience & Skills
- 3+ years QA experience with a broad knowledge of best practices is essential.
- Demonstrable test framework implementations on more than one tech stack.
- Deep understanding of SQL, jQuery, XML, REST/JSON).
- Deep understanding of web, API & database testing technologies and frameworks.
- Experience in test data design and implementation strategies.
- Experience with API test framework design for legacy back-end systems.
- Experience coaching junior members of a QA team.
- Experience of Agile Scrum, Kanban & behavioural-driven development (BDD).
- Experience of build pipelines using common CI/CD and SCM tools (e.g. GIT, Jenkins, TeamCity).
- Experience with automated testing incl. compatibility & performance testing an advantage.

jobs.title: Customer Operations Executive - Pensions Detective
jobs.description:
Moneybox wants to help a generation invest in their future. As part of this mission we are launching a new service to help customers track down old pensions. This is a huge problem for people - in the UK 25m+ people are paying into a pension and 50%+ of people can’t even name their pension providers! 

You will be our first permanent ‘pensions detective’ working within the customer operations team processing pension transfers. You’ll be helping customers locate their pensions and identifying ways to systemise and automate the search process to provide the best “detective” service at scale. You’ll work within the Customer Operations team transferring pensions, as well as liaising with the product team to improve the transfer process.

To track down the pension provider for a broad range of employers, you’ll need to use a wide variety of sources, including calling employers, desk research, reading company accounts, etc. You’ll be looking at ways to make this process more efficient, helping us to scale the service to 100,000s of customers. You’ll also learn the transfer process, and lead in helping our customers find their policy numbers with providers through helpful communication and different product-led initiatives.


What you'll do
- Work within the Customer Operations team transferring pensions and the product team in tasks such as:
- Running pension provider searches against employers as customers request these.
- Liaising with customers to keep them up to date of progress and asking for any additional information we require.
- Managing initiatives to recover customer policy numbers with providers.
- Working with the broader pensions operations team to ensure that we can help customers through the end-to-end process of locating and transferring pensions to Moneybox.
- Working with the product manager to find ways to systematise,automate and scale the search process where possible 


Who you are
- A driven, ambitious individual who’s excited to start their career at a very fast growing company during a period of new product and feature development.
- Someone with an analytic approach and ‘can do’ problem-solving attitude to help make sure we do everything we can to help track down a customer’s pension.
- Customer-focused and able to communicate sometimes complex concepts to customers in a friendly manner.
- Someone who is able to pull together key concepts and patterns and then build out a systematic, scalable process.
- Naturally personable, great communicator who has a passion for their work.Knows how to have fun whilst maintaining a professional outlook.


Experience and Skills
- Excellent written and spoken English.
- Strong initiative and ability to work well both individually and as part of a team.
- Good analytical and problem solving skills.
- Great communication and listening skills.
- Meticulous attention to detail.

jobs.description:
We are currently growing at a rapid pace with more and more people using Moneybox. To support this growth we are looking for a budding Android Developer.
 

This role will be responsible for working within a dedicated team to develop the Moneybox Android app. You will work alongside other developers to maintain a high quality app and develop new features that enhance the overall experience.
Octopus Deploy for automated releases.

- Help to suggest new features for the application that will make the app experience better for users, and that will make the application more reliable.
- Break down stories into manageable chunks that allow features to be developed in an iterative manner that allow us to release regularly so we can gain feedback from our users.
- Estimate features so that we can get a reliable release date estimate for the rest of the company and users.
- Support the design of the architecture of the android application.
- Release the app when all the features for the release have been developed.
- Monitor the app post-release to ensure that it is working as expected.


What we’re looking for
- Someone who is excited about making an application you would use personally that helps make saving and investing easier and more accessible.
- Thrives in a fast-pace startup environment.
- Interested in all areas of the business and enjoys hearing about what other team members are working on.
- Genuine interest in financial technology.
- Constantly looking to improve all areas that you can affect.
- Excited about learning and experience new ways of thinking.


Experience and Skills 
- Computer science or related degree.

  • Interact with the product manager and designers to refine ideas into fully specified user stories, that define how the user will interact with the application.
  • Help to suggest new features for the application that will make the app experience better for users, and that will make the application more reliable.
  • Break down stories into manageable chunks that allow features to be developed in an iterative manner that allow us to release regularly so we can gain feedback from our users.
  • Estimate features so that we can get a reliable release date estimate for the rest of the company and users.
  • Support the design of the architecture of the android application.
  • Release the app when all the features for the release have been developed.
  • Monitor the app post-release to ensure that it is working as expected.

What we’re looking for

  • Someone who is excited about making an application you would use personally that helps make saving and investing easier and more accessible.
  • Thrives in a fast-pace startup environment.
  • Interested in all areas of the business and enjoys hearing about what other team members are working on.
  • Genuine interest in financial technology.
  • Constantly looking to improve all areas that you can affect.
  • Excited about learning and experience new ways of thinking.

Experience and Skills

  • Computer science or related degree.
  • Proven experience within software development and/or Android development.
  • Proficient in Java and/or Kotlin
  • Experience using common libraries such as RxJava2, Dagger2, Retrofit etc
  • Exposure to creating rich and extensive mobile interfaces.
  • Exposure across most aspects of software development from gathering requirements to releasing.
  • Great communication and listening skills.
  • Fluent written and spoken English.

What’s in it for you?

  • Opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at a fast-growing, award-winning and super ambitious startup.
  • Work with a friendly team of highly-motivated individuals.
  • Be in an environment where you are listened to and can play a key role in impacting the finance industry in the UK.
  • Thriving collaborative and inclusive company culture.
  • Competitive remuneration package.
  • Company share options.
  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
